Question
========

The difference between `5L` and `5` is that `5L` results in an atomic vector of type [[1]] while `5` results in an atomic vector of type [[2]].

Which ordered pair of words replaces [[1]] and [[2]] to best complete the sentence?

Answerlist
----------
* `integer`, `double`
* `double`, `integer`
* `integer`, `character`
* `character`, `double`
* `double`, `character`


Solution
========

```{r, eval=FALSE, include=FALSE}
class(5)
typeof(5)
class(5L)
typeof(5L)
```

Answerlist
----------
* Correct
* No, it's the opposite.
* No, `5` is a `double`.
* No, `5L` is an `integer`.
* No, `5L` is an `integer`.
